if state is present but cert, key or chain is not passed in, then these variables won't be set at all. That is bad.

Just get rid of the `if` statements.
No need for `default=None` or `required=False` in the argument_spec.

comments.body: This looks good. In addition to removing the ifs can you add a required_if to [AnsibleModule](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/24206/files#diff-ee240e40955a7a90ec4e28effc4a4570L250)? ...something like required_if=[('state', 'present', ['cert', 'cert_chain', 'key'])] so the user gets a helpful error
I agree to a degree, however by doing so you force people to specify those params when they simply want to rename.

I know this has already been merged, however did this make the module less friendly for those using it on remote hosts?  i.e.  lookup will not work and therefore slurp would have to be used, and an extra task added in order to achieve the same thing.
See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/20787 for another alternative, which was since removed.
@ProjectRice Good point. If you get a chance would you please review https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/26097 so paths can be specified?
